'''Epessë''', [[Quenya]] for '''after-name''', is a nickname or honorific given to an elf at some point in his or her life. It is one of the '''[[essë|anessi]]''', or given names, of [[High Elves]], along with the '''[[father-name]]'''<ref group="note">There is no attested Quenya term for this name, but we can conjecture it is ''ataressë''.</ref>  and '''[[amilessë]]''' ("mother-name").<ref>{{PM|Mother}}, p. 339</ref> The epessë was a public name, and the person it was given to sometimes adopted it as one of his or her actual names.<ref>{{MR|P3II3a}}, p. 216</ref>

An example is ''Gil-galad'' ("Star of Radiance"), by which the last [[High King of the Noldor]] [[Gil-galad|Ereinion]] ("''Scion of Kings''") was chiefly remembered in legend. This eponymous epithet was given to him because his armour and shield were overlaid with silver and set with a device of white stars, shone from afar like a star in sunlight or moonlight and could be seen by Elvish eyes at a great distance if he stood upon a height.<ref name=Galad>{{PM|Finwe}}, p. 346-7</ref> The element 'galad' also appears in an epessë ''Galadriel'', which is a [[Sindarin]] name that belonged to Ereinion's kinswoman [[Galadriel|Artanis]] and translated as "maiden crowned with a garland of bright radiance".<ref name=Galad/>

==Etymology==
''Epessë'' comes from ''[[epe]]'' ("after") + ''[[essë]]'' ("name").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1296043367.html|articlename=Q. ''epessë'' n.|website=Eldamo|accessed=5 November 2020}}</ref>
